name: Ninety Six National Historic Site
description: Settlers struggled against the harsh backcountry to survive. Cherokee Indians hunted and fought to keep their land. Two towns and a trading post were formed then abandoned to the elements. And two Revolutionary War battles claimed over 100 lives. Come discover the 18th century history of South Carolina.
shortDescription: Settlers struggled against the harsh backcountry to survive. Cherokee Indians hunted and fought to keep their land. Two towns and a trading post were formed then abandoned to the elements. And two Rev...

operatingHours.description: The park grounds are open from sunrise to sunset. There are eight parking spots located outside of the front gate for early and late visitors.

climate.weatherDescription: Temperatures for the area range from very hot and humid in the summer to cool and moderate in the winter.

images.title: Cannon and Maham Tower
images.altText: A cannon is in the left foreground with the Maham rifle tower in the distance.
images.caption: Cannon and Maham Tower

images.title: Exhibit in the Fog
images.altText: A corten steel figure of a Native American stands sentinel in the fog.
images.caption: A corten steel figure of a Native American stands sentinel in the fog.

images.title: 1781 Battlefield View
images.altText: The walking trail winds past a cannon and a rifle tower.
images.caption: The walking trail winds past a cannon and a rifle tower.

images.title: Road Signs
images.altText: A wooden sign shows the direction of important places in 1781.
images.caption: A wooden sign shows the direction of important places in 1781.

images.title: Birmingham Monument
images.altText: A monument to James Birmingham, the first South Carolinian to die in the American Revolution
images.caption: A monument to patriot James Birmingham, the first South Carolinian to die in the American Revolution

images.title: Tent Row
images.altText: A British regimental coat hangs on a tent.
images.caption: A British regimental coat hangs on the middle tent during a special event.

images.title: Divine Service
images.altText: Reenactors listen as another reenactor presents and 18th century church service.
images.caption: Reenactors sit in chairs in front of the Black Swan Tavern as another reenactor presents and 18th century church service.

images.title: Flag at Stockade
images.altText: A British flag flies over the stockade fort.
images.caption: A British flag flies over the stockade fort.

images.title: Sign and Flag
images.altText: A blue Liberty flag is in the right foreground with the park entrance sign behind it.
images.caption: A blue Liberty flag is in the right foreground with the park entrance sign behind it during a special event.
